alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 11:33AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Niobrara, northeastern Albany, northwestern Platte and eastern Converse Counties through 1215 PM MDT... At 1133 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles south of Pine Tree Junction to near Esterbrook. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Douglas, Glendo, Esterbrook, Sibley Peak, Friend Park Campground, Two Moon Campground, Laramie Peak, Esterbrook Campground, Bill, Glendo Reservoir, Harris Park, Manning Ranch, Dull Center and Lost Springs. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 95 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range
